alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:29AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WARREN AND WESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 600 AM EDT... At 529 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Waynesville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Springboro, Wilmington, Blanchester, Waynesville, Morrow, South Lebanon, Maineville, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Corwin, Midland, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, Murdock, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Fort Ancient, Lytle, and Lumberton. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 28 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
